website_summaries.verdict: A space-saver with multiple functions and reliable performance. Hands down the best in quality and value (if it will fit beneath your cabinets).
pros: Mounts under cabinets and is built to last
Includes a bottle opener and knife sharpener
cons: works best with those that have flat bottoms, though modifications could be made

customer_reviews.title: Hard to find in stores
customer_reviews.text: When we sold our old house I let my spacemaker can opener go with it because I figured I could easily replace it. Definitely not the case, my old one was white to match my cabinets and they are impossible to find now. After looking in several stores, I ordered this one because I hate a can opener sitting on my counter. Even though it is black, I'm happy to have it! If I ever move again I will take this one with me, my old one (same brand and style) was over 15 years old and still worked like it was brand new so hopefully this one will be as great!
customer_reviews.author: StephanieCTop Contributor: Running

customer_reviews.title: Will not fit under cabinet!
customer_reviews.text: The product description does not say it can only be installed in cabinets that have no lip in the front bottom, that is the cabinet has to have a flush bottom. My cabinet has a 5/8" lip and will require some reworking to make in fit. If I knew of this limitation I would not have bought it. Black + Decker should supply adaptors/extensions to fit cabinets with bottom lips.
customer_reviews.author: HKSac

customer_reviews.title: worked great. Now they only make this thing
customer_reviews.text: We had an old Black & Decker can opener for years, worked great. Now they only make this thing, much larger, and we couldn't put it under our cabinet. Instructions say will only work under cabinets with "flush bottoms", which ours isn't. And to remove the cutting blade for cleaning, it has to be turned vertical, but you can't because it hits the bottom of the cabinet......STUPID. They reinvented the wheel, and it came out square. I sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen G.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit after some adjustments.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't know you couldn't place this under a cabinet that had a front overhang, but after placing a piece of wood under the cabinet to use as a spacer it fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Fits nice has bottle opener and knife sharpener
customer_reviews.text: I like it I didn't realize that you've not supposed to install it with a lip. I used the spacers that came with it. No issues
customer_reviews.author: J. Schumaker

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you have very flat bottom cabinets unless you are a handy man!
customer_reviews.text: Horrible design for mounting. Don't know how you would mount it even with flat bottom cabinets. Would have to drill down thru casing very close to the edge. Opener has to extend out front of cabinet for lever to clear. My cabinets not flat bottom. Mounted block of wood to opener then to bottom of cabinet to get necessary clearance. Opener mechanism is pretty standard and basic. Don't understand the design of the front cover. Can''t believe designers did not consider customers who have cabinets with a bottom lip, and most do.
customer_reviews.author: Customer 12

customer_reviews.title: Not a good choice
customer_reviews.text: This product is a bad design because the screw holes are to close to the front edge of the can opener. I did not use the can opener because I would have had to drill holes in the facing of my cabinets to install in order to have the clearance to open and operate the device. I have an older space saver Black and Decker can opener and it has been great. A friend fixed the old one by welding a piece back on (used 20 + years). Please go back to the old design.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Make your own template for drill holes. After drilling ...
customer_reviews.text: Make your own template for drill holes. After drilling the holes were off by 1/8”. This was not only frustrating but disappointing. There are spacers provided, yet until you install it( after trying to adjust drill holes) you will not know that you will need space from the top so the front cover can properly open and close. The instruction only mention fit the mounting screws to stick out 1/2”, go for the next size longer so you can utilize the spacers. Save your self time and money. Keep shopping.
customer_reviews.author: a

customer_reviews.title: Always wanted on of these
customer_reviews.text: I have always wanted an under the cabinet can opener. this is a multi-function unit with bottle opener and knife sharpener. Took some finagling to get it hung up as I have a lip on the bottom of my cabinets. Directions say it can only be installed on bottom cabinets but we managed to make it work just fine using the extra spacers and long screws they included. Feels sturdy and works wonderfully.
customer_reviews.author: Mandi

customer_reviews.title: Sub $100.00 under counter electric can opener - good luck finding another
customer_reviews.text: As the only sub $100.00 electric can opener for under counters I could find "anywhere" it's easily a 5-star appliance. So far works very well with no issues. Cover feature a nice addition to the previous model we had.
customer_reviews.author: Sean M.

customer_reviews.title: Best can opener ever! Long lasting.
customer_reviews.text: This was one of the first purchases for our new house that we bought in 2017. My wife uses it daily. After 3 years it still works perfectly. I use the bottle opener frequently as well. It's extremely convenient. My only real complaint is with the knife sharpener. It's awful. It has ruined and chipped the edge of any knife I've tried sharpening with it. And the placement of It makes it awkward to use anyways. The sharpener is complete garbage and I'd be happier if weren't there at all. Overall, very happy with it, very highly recommend it. And definitely will purchase again when/if we wear ours out.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb

customer_reviews.title: Was prepared to be disappointed... confused now.
customer_reviews.text: So far, it works great. I had a 1" lip on my under cabinet, so I appreciated the warnings in other reviews, but I have had no problems with fitting cans in, etc. I was definitely prepared to be disappointed and had considered purchasing a 20 year old model for nearly $100 in order to get the same can opener I had before, but now I'm glad I didn't. I have had none of the issues mentioned in other reviews. So... uh, I was disappointed that I wasn't disappointed? I was not... uh... I was dis... oh, whatever. I like the damn thing.
customer_reviews.author: JaydeRaven

customer_reviews.title: My mom loves it!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a Christmas present for my mother, she had been looking for an electric opener for awhile and couldnt find one. I found this one and was a little hesitant because it looked so big. But I went ahead and ordered it. My mom was shocked I found one and my dad said that it was easy to install on the bottom of their upper cabniets and mom says that it is really easy to use and get the job done. I am so happy that she loves it
customer_reviews.author: Busymom

customer_reviews.title: Clear the decks
customer_reviews.text: I like the idea of under cabinet mounting to keep the countertops clear. The door seems to be an addition simply for aesthetics. It's a can opener, no big deal & the inner workings look neat enough. The opener works fine, but the process grinds up the top portion of the can label & if you're not careful, it lands inside the can. Hubby was careful to read the installation instructions as others had issues with that. All went well. This is my 3rd under cabinet opener. Also have an under cabinet toaster oven & coffee maker. Very convenient & helps keep 'all decks clear'.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Good opener but could be better.
customer_reviews.text: Not the best of can openers. It does mount under the upper cabinets so it's pretty much out of the way and convenient to use. However the cover doesn't open and close very well. It only comes in black. It doesn't reliably hang on to a can for opening. It doesn't handle a large can well at all, for example a 3 pound coffee can. A large food can, well, I just get out the old hand crank opener from the drawer. I have not tried the knife sharpener.
customer_reviews.author: Peter S

customer_reviews.title: Not a good under the cabinet fit
customer_reviews.text: After my old Black & Decker died I had really hoped this would be a decent replacement. I wish the description would have mentioned that it was intended for mounting under a flat bottom cabinet. Tried to add wood as a spacer (I just now read it was suppose to come with plastic spacers, mine did not), did not like how it lined up. I would suggest the manufacturer forget the lid/cover (it will probably break anyway) and add a mounting bracket to drop down the unit like the older models came with.
customer_reviews.author: Red2

customer_reviews.title: I'm not happy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this unit because we have a house full of B & D products and to date have never been unhappy. The promo says nothing about mounting this unit until you have received the can opener and see on the face of the product info that this is not made for my type installation. This is made for a flush mount and I have a recessed mount. WHAT CAN WE DO TO MAKE ME HAPPY? This is the second communication to you and we have not heard from you. Please contact us and tell us what you propose to do.
customer_reviews.author: jimcollins

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Value and clean look
customer_reviews.text: Its a little bulky but I really like the cover that is easily opened. I couldn't find any other BLACK built-in can opener for this price. They all 3x the cost. I have had it for several months and no problems so far. I had a white Black & Decker for over 17 years that didn't have a cover but i changed out my kitchen appliances so i wanted a black can opener as well. I like the clean sleek look with the cover that you open by a simple push and release on the upper portion.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: At 'first look, it seems a good replacement for older unit.
customer_reviews.text: It installs best on a flat bottom cabinet, but with provided spacers, it can probably be installed in almost any configuration. This replaces one of the older space-saver units which presented the same installation issues, and I worked that one out the same way with provided materials. I'm not as happy with the new design - the flip down front cover, but it will probably work out. Would have like a color choice to match my older coffee maker, but I guess black is the new white.
customer_reviews.author: Randall Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Nice appliance
customer_reviews.text: I have used the "gismo" for years. It finally decided to "die"! This can opener fits in the same place as the gizmo. I love that I don't have to have another thing sitting on my counter top. It is pretty much hidden under the top cabinet yet easy to get to. Not only does it have a can opener but also a bag opener, bottle opener and knife sharpener. I hope it lasts as long as my gizmo!
customer_reviews.author: L Compher

customer_reviews.title: Bought to replace a 15 year old space saver. Wish the old one still worked!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love Black a Decker things and although I know styles change and technology is advanced - this can opener just isn’t as good as my old B&D one that stopped working. It wasn’t as easy to install as expected and when completed it just is average. We have to hold a larger can as it seems harder to open. It’s just ok. Nothing special. Expensive for what we got.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: Nice opener space saver.
customer_reviews.text: Have bought a couple of these now off of amazon, grandmother liked ours so much she ask for one as well. We order one for our house looking to replace our old style after 20 years, it is a nice looking can opener that fits under the counter so it helps out in our kitchen with space as well. It is recommended for cabinets that do not have a lip on them that are flush. Mine have a lip but I was still able to install, you just have to place the unit far enough under the counter for the door to still open and not hit the lip.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley S.

customer_reviews.title: Harder to find these
customer_reviews.text: Hard to find these - so limited, unless you want to pay a lot. I don't! This one was not that bad on price. Didn't have a flat bottom to mount as required, but I use a board to take up the space. No problems... Rather harder to get it working compared to my old 25+yrs old kitchen aid that finally died. Lever is smaller and can has to be set proper position. It works and its not taking up counter space :-)
customer_reviews.author: Elad

customer_reviews.title: works just fine but one feature missing from our previous opener is ...
customer_reviews.text: works just fine but one feature missing from our previous opener is what my wife misses most....old one had a jar opener for twist off lids like on pickle jar or similar. Now jar opening my job again. This missing feature made it a 4 star vs 5 star rating in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Janig

customer_reviews.title: Study the set up before you install
customer_reviews.text: So far we have not had a problem with the product. We do have to open our cabinet doors in order to lift the cutter thing high enough to get the can in place. We have flat bottom cabinets, but the can opener would have to be installed with the bolts right at the front edge of the cabinet...not sure how stable that would be. But, for the moment we are able to use the can opener and it is working fine.
customer_reviews.author: Designing Judy

customer_reviews.title: Poor Mounting Hardware - Would Not Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Been through 2 units, both broke on install. Each unit had one of the retainer clips for the mounting screws strip out and spinning inside the unit. The retainer clips broke free from the plastic rails that were holding them in place which prevented me from being able to tighten the mounting screw up. I had to use a Dremel to cut the head off of the screw just to get the unit back down. I am a pretty handy guy around the house and installed the previous can opener (which lasted many years) and never had such issues with cheap workmanship. I would not recommend this unit due to the cheap construction.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Can Opener! Best Price! Best Shipping!
customer_reviews.text: Great under the counter space saving can opener. Also has a knife sharpner that works pretty well. Very prompt shipping and affordable price when looking at the newer models. I would definitely purchase again. Installation to cabinet is pretty easy and washers come with the bolts to help with the depth of the area from directly underneath the cabinet to the bottom edge of the cabinet which was very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to install
customer_reviews.text: I have not installed it yet because my under cabinet is recessed and instructions are for a flat bottomed cabinet...(most standard cabinets are NOT flat bottomed) so I have to find a way. The other problem is the front cover feels as though it is going to break off easily. I would like to see another color choice also.
customer_reviews.author: doggiemom5

customer_reviews.title: Can opener
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been looking for an under the counter can opener for years and finally found this one. This is great but it doesn’t have the bag cutter on the side like my old one. That was really handy. I don’t like the knife sharpener on the side. Doesn’t work at all
customer_reviews.author: squeakylu

customer_reviews.title: Undercounter hard to install
customer_reviews.text: Do not like the cover. It should be a choice. This must be installed on the edge. The top of the can opener should be taller so when you open latch to grab can it isnt bumping into the cabinet its installed to. I have had so much trouble trying to get this installed, we have decided to give up and get something else.
customer_reviews.author: L.M.

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as previous Black and Decker
customer_reviews.text: I think the quality of this item is not what it once was. We had a Black and Decker before this that looked like this and has lasted us many years. I am already having issues with this one. Frequently I cannot get it to cut all the way around a can, the first time it happened I thought it was just that particular can but it happens about a third of the time.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl P

customer_reviews.title: So Far So Good
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with my space saving can opener. Works well. Although I wish I knew this was for cabinets that didn't have overhang but nonetheless, I didn't place as recommended. I installed a few inches back and it works just fine. I'll update a few months down the road as I've only had a few weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Cuchador

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking and effective can opener! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this spacemaker under the cabinet can opener to replace another older one of the same brand. This one works great! We're so glad we purchased it. Easy to set up and operate. Also has a bag opener and knife sharpener. Overall, a nice looking and effective opener. We didn't like nor need the handy door cover and removed it.
customer_reviews.author: University DocTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Can opener outsmarts homemaker
customer_reviews.text: Sent back. Too difficult for me to install. What is the cover on front supposed to do? Get in the way? All I want is parts for my GE Spacemaker under cabinet mounted can opener that has seen service for 37 years and still valiantly opens cans but is missing parts.. I have resorted using manual can opener.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Ward

customer_reviews.title: Installation the only problem.
customer_reviews.text: Had a problem installing since screws sand spacers furnished were not long enough to clear the overhanging cabinet lip. Found longer metric screws finally and used spacers from the previous unit to install. Works great Glad B&D finally have an under-counter unit again. Would have preferred SAE screws for mounting.
customer_reviews.author: G. Bishop

customer_reviews.title: I liked the design which I could view with your wonderful ...
customer_reviews.text: I liked the design which I could view with your wonderful touch the screen and it opens up to a better view of the areas I wanted to see. The price was very nice the delivery was very quick. I am very happy with this under the counter can opener. Could not find anything like it at a brick and mortar store. I like the way it closes up when not in use and can open large cans easily. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Linny P

customer_reviews.title: Good can opener so far
customer_reviews.text: Our old Spacemaker can opener finally opened its last can after at least 20 years. It was a sad day. These undercounter can openers are not easy to find in stores anymore so I ordered from Amazon, and without too much trouble put the new in place of the old. So far this unit has done well. The door on the front was at first a little annoying but we have grown to like the look and found that it is not too much trouble. I can only hope to have as good a service life from this unit as we had with our old one.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny M

customer_reviews.title: Better than average opener.
customer_reviews.text: Most cans have pop tops now. (at least the ones I buy) but there are holdouts where you still need a can opener. I sometimes have an issue with this opener getting started on the can edge. Every once in a while you have to try several times to get it to bite so the can can start turning on the opener.
customer_reviews.author: Sherian

customer_reviews.title: Works for me
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as it was the only under-cabinet can opener I could find at the time and have been perfectly happy with it. It performs multiple tasks, opens pretty much any sized can, and was not difficult to mount under cupboard. I've had it for maybe a couple of years now and had no problems or complaints with it. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: sjd1

customer_reviews.title: ... finally get it aligned it opens the cans just fine. It also has a knife sharpener on the ...
customer_reviews.text: Don't really care much for the front cover and it's a little difficult to actually get a can into the correct position to connect with the cutting blade but when you finally get it aligned it opens the cans just fine. It also has a knife sharpener on the side.
customer_reviews.author: Robin C

customer_reviews.title: Works great, hard to install, remove the useless door
customer_reviews.text: I had a B&D spacemaker can opener for 20 years. When the motor finally gave out, I bought this one to replace it. No mention in the description that it is ONLY FOR FLAT BOTTOM CABINETS. Also, the "sleek appearing" door is basically useless and in the way. After a trip to the store for hardware, I was able to fashion a way to install using a piece of wood, the spacers provided, AND the old spacers from my previous opener. I also removed the door. Now it works great! I gave a 5 for durability based on the previous model. If this holds true, I will be happy.
customer_reviews.author: Jerome

customer_reviews.title: quirks
customer_reviews.text: I gave it 4 stars because even though it works great. their is still room for improvement in this product. the piece that conceals the can opener sometimes sticks in the hinges and you really have to wiggle the cans to get them in the right position to open, this is mostly because if it is mounted under a cabinet you can only lift the lever so far before it hits the bottom of the cabinet.
customer_reviews.author: player

customer_reviews.title: will not mount easily completely under cabinet
customer_reviews.text: The design for mounting the can opener completely UNDER the cabinet is poor, poor, poor. It will NOT mount completely under the cabinet bottom and still function without significant adaptation. It has to mount far enough forward of the cabinet bottom to allow the handle to raise completely. Even if you have a flat bottom cabinet. If you intend to mount it so that it is completely under the cabinet bottom you have to use spacers and screws that are far longer than those provided. Long Metric screws not easily found at the local hardware store are required and not provided.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Yates

customer_reviews.title: Just right for under the counter
customer_reviews.text: Best for the price as it is hard to find these anymore. It is best to mount on a thin piece of wood first using the template , then it is easier to screw into your cabinet from the top and you do not have a difficult time matching up the desired screw holes. It works great. The bottle opener is a little hard to get used to , but not a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Tom of Fort Worth

customer_reviews.title: Perfect choice definitely recommend it to anyone who wants this kind of product
customer_reviews.text: Fast delivery and perfect price. Just what we were looking for. Did the job we needed to do. Definitely recommend it to the customers who needs this product.
customer_reviews.author: Matt W.

customer_reviews.title: Undercounter can opener
customer_reviews.text: I love this type of can opener as it is off my counter and out of the way. My son installed it for us and he was challenged doing it but I am enjoying it even though there are several times the paper on the cans is so thick I have to redo a couple of times.
customer_reviews.author: luvakins

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased. Easy to install if you have the right tools. Works very well. Compact. The front door closes over it to conceal the works.
customer_reviews.author: seywhut

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, perfect for any kitchen!
customer_reviews.text: I enjoyed getting the compact canopener and it installed quickly although the template was not included in my model which required some invention to match up holes to frame due to the proximity to the edge of the cupboard. The holes had to be drilled upward instead of downward. Works very well and offers room for large cans that might not fit smaller models. Easy to detach for cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory L Smith

customer_reviews.title: Must have FLAT under counters.
customer_reviews.text: Works great.. BUT.. if you don’t have a FLAT under counter you’ll have to get creative.. I have a edge that hangs down on the edges of my counter, could by just install like it was. See pictures. Had to attach a piece of wood to allow for the gap.. Comes with no offfered support for non flat under counters.
customer_reviews.author: April T.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Simple to install and easy to operate. Just make sure if you’re putting it under cabinets that you account for the handle on the inside. It is a great product and very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy it, get the hand held instead
customer_reviews.text: Would not purchase again. Wanted a white one but not paying the money difference for it. Why put a cover over the front, we know it’s a can opener under the cabinet. The instructions are horrible and my son had to improvise in the installation.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous buyer

customer_reviews.title: Spacemaker can operner
customer_reviews.text: I like the idea of this can opener but it certainly is not the quality of my old one. Some cans are difficult to get connected to it but when it works it does a good job.
customer_reviews.author: Marylinda Vetter

customer_reviews.title: Not really a space maker
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this item to replace a older SpaceMaker undercounter can opener. The older can opener was mounted at the back of the cabinet and discovered that this one needs to be mounted at the front of the cabinet and hangs down so far that it makes it difficult to use that area of the counter. . And because of the pull down cover design it wouldn't work at the back of the cabinet. The write up did not mention that it needed to be mounted at the front of the cabinet.
customer_reviews.author: Cali

customer_reviews.title: The under the counter
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE the under the counter, the sturdiness, but cleaning them is ALWAYS going to be a problem. but this item is definitely the best one I have purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Miriam

customer_reviews.title: under counter can opener.
customer_reviews.text: Unit looks good under cabinet. Easy to mount. Plenty of spacer combinations and screw lengths provided to make it hang low enough to work with 1" lip on face of cabinet. Only draw back is the face cover is a little hard to close. You have to play with tightening the mounting screws to adjust to close properly. Works great and motor is quiet. Mount close as possible to front of cabinet to provide ease of operating lever. Was not sure about it due to low cost but am glad I got it.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Machtan

customer_reviews.title: TO HARD TO WORK
customer_reviews.text: IF ALL YOU ARE LOOKING FOR IS TO OPEN A SMALL CAN OF TUNA THEN THIS IS FOR YOU BUT THE TOP OPENS VERY LITTLE AND ANYTHING LARGER THAN A VERY SMALL CAN THIS PRODUCT WILL NOT WORK FOR YOU.
customer_reviews.author: CYNTHIA MCGOWAN

customer_reviews.title: can opener
customer_reviews.text: works pretty good, but have a little trouble with the larger cans. my husband uses it more than I do. I like the older version better. we had it for 20+ years and was made sturdier than this one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't like the counter top openers as they take up space ...
customer_reviews.text: Had one of these before this one and it finally wore out. Seems to be the only one out there now that mounts under the cabinet. So long as it works. Don't like the counter top openers as they take up space on the counter.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R. Rees

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd Black and Decker can opener we have had. The first one lasted so long, it became obsolete, and we finally had to replace it. The fold up cover is really nice so the inside doesn't show.
customer_reviews.author: Donna H.

customer_reviews.title: This was a win for me.
customer_reviews.text: Best price for this item the day I bought it was here at Amazon. Specal note: Installation requires that you NOT install it under a cabinet that has a lip of wood on the front of the cabinet hanging below the plane of the cabinet underside. You don't know about that until you read the installation instructions. It's not a deal-breaker. I just cut a piece of wood that was as thick as the extra overhang, attached it underneath the cabinet, and then installed on that. They give you mounting screws of various lengths, so the long ones reach through all that.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Oppelt

customer_reviews.title: Good can opener
customer_reviews.text: Good can opener, but it is a little loud. The other one I purchased from Black and Decker was a little more quiet. Lasted a long time. Very dependable.
customer_reviews.author: Lvmovies

customer_reviews.title: I really like this Space Maker
customer_reviews.text: I really like this Space Maker, it is right under the cabinets I keep my canned goods in (since I'm not lucky enough to have a pantry). My only beef with it is that opening cans of tuna and other meats can get messy because of the water they are packed in, and the blade is very hard to clean. You end up with crusty bits of can juices dried in places you can't reach. If it weren't for that it would totally get 5 stars. Not that I cared about the knife sharpener, but for anybody that's wondering, it sucks :) Get a dedicated sharpener for you knives and you'll be set.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not for false bottom cabinet installation
customer_reviews.text: Did not work on my cabinets, I have false bottom cabinets and this opener has to be bolted in from the top and it would need longer bolts , also I did not want the bolt heads to be in the cabninet where my dishes would have to lay on the bolt heads, I never even un-boxed it just looked at the instructions and decided it was not what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: P. Sil

customer_reviews.title: I would highly recommend this, and it’s a great price
customer_reviews.text: I love the space saver CanOpener it’s perfect in that little corner I have it in and I never have to fight with it to get a little off or risk cutting my hand.
customer_reviews.author: GSXR

customer_reviews.title: Never worked properly.
customer_reviews.text: This product would never open a can easily. Start, stop, start, stop. I would rip the paper off the can, but the top, well many times 2 or more minutes fooling with it. After a little over a year the gear stripped, and thank goodness now I don't feel bad about buying something else.
customer_reviews.author: It'sGot2Go

customer_reviews.title: This product must fit the cabinet to be installed upon.
customer_reviews.text: This can opener did not fit my style of kitchen cabinets. It was returned to Amazon, my money was refunded, and I purchased another brand instead.
customer_reviews.author: Zip 66043

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: Works good, does the job. Much easier than a manual can opener. I would rather not have the little door cover on it, it just gets in the way having to open and close it all the time. I prefer the older version that I used to have.
customer_reviews.author: LC

customer_reviews.title: So happy! Works great
customer_reviews.text: I've been searching for so long for a can opener that mounts under the cabinet, ours was getting very old abs it seemed no one made these anymore. So happy! Works great. We had to make a couple adjustments to mounting since our cabinets aren't flat underneath with the front piece but we made it work!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love the ease of use
customer_reviews.text: Was easy to put in and works great. It replaces one we had for more than 30 years. Hopefully this one will last close to that. Good quality, opens cans quickly, closable to hide when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Lorrie andrews

customer_reviews.title: Not easily mountable unless cabinets are flat underneath.
customer_reviews.text: If your cabinets have a lip underneath, this can opener will be more difficult to mount. I read in the instruction booklet that this can opener is recommended for flat bottomed cabinets, but it isn't mentioned in the product details that i read before purchasing. Still, when comparing prices, the money you save is worth the struggle.
customer_reviews.author: RICHARD W. PARKER

customer_reviews.title: Not bad...but
customer_reviews.text: Hope it last as long as my last one. I’m not to crazy about the cover. It sorta gets in the way, and it has problems with larger cans. But of course that could have been me.
customer_reviews.author: Laura S

customer_reviews.title: B&D junk can opener
customer_reviews.text: This product is almost impossible to use. Bought in June and have tried to use only 3 or 4 times. Each time I have fought with it for 10 minutes trying to get it to grab and open the can. My previous B&D Space Saver worked like a charm but left it behind when I moved. Now Im going to have to get a manual can opener instead of fighting with this piece of junk. No more Black and Decker for me. They make junk now.
customer_reviews.author: Dary O'Dell

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn't buy it again but it does the job
customer_reviews.text: Made a weird noise upon installation. Installing it was interesting because my cabinets have a 3/4" recess underneath. Removal for cleaning will be impossible due to not enough spacers underneath.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: convenient under the counter can opener
customer_reviews.text: Everyone stopped making under the counter can openers for awhile so I was happy to find this one. I didn't like flip up, flip down cover that hides the can opener mechanism, so I removed it. Does a good job and is holding up well.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Looks great!
customer_reviews.text: This was a surprise gift from my husband and I love it! Quiet and looks nice and neat when folded up under the cabinet. I’ve had it for almost a year with no problems!
customer_reviews.author: Deanna

customer_reviews.title: I've looked everywhere and was so happy to see black and Decker finally came out with ...
customer_reviews.text: My aunt has been looking for one of these to replace her old one she got years ago! I've looked everywhere and was so happy to see black and Decker finally came out with one at a great price! Works well and my aunt loved it!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Since this is a larger size than our old Spacemaker Can Opener it required new mounting holes. I do not understand why they had to change the mounting holes. Be sure you follow the directions as the door to the can opener must have room to swing down. The door sometimes does not stay closed and drops down. It probably should have been designed without a door, like the previous models.
customer_reviews.author: Charles M

customer_reviews.title: Another Great Product From Black & Decker
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Replacing my old can counter top opener with this Space Maker was a smart move. Cleared much need space immediately. It was easy to install. Works great. I like that the blade is hidden. Only down side is the tab on the flip door. The tab appears to be a bit flimsy. I don't expect it to stay on very long after a few uses. Other than that I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Tita

customer_reviews.title: i loved the original model with the jar opener on the ...
customer_reviews.text: i loved the original model with the jar opener on the bottom, we moved and left it bought a new one, was great but not the same. this one somehow is not as good as either of those. i find the cover odd, i just wish they would make the original one again, it was the best ever
customer_reviews.author: M. griffin

customer_reviews.title: Check your cabinets for compatability!  Doesn't fit cabinets with a top lip or an overhang. Fits fully flat bottom cabinet only.
customer_reviews.text: Sorry but this model doesn't fit under cabinets with an overhang, the cabinet must be entirely flat underneath. I am replacing an older spacemaker can opener that did fit my cabinet that has an overhang. Now I have to pay shipping to return it. I believe the installation restrictions on this product should be made very clear in the specs, not even a warning on the box. Now I know why the old, white colored models are going for $180 here, not just because they don't make white anymore but because you can install them on more cabinets.
customer_reviews.author: Carlo

customer_reviews.title: It did not install as easy as indicated in video
customer_reviews.text: I will come back and revise this after some use but for now this was difficult to install because we have a lip under our cabinets but the template provided was a 1/16" off which created problems in that the screws did not align. Two hours later with some DYI and extra wood we have it installed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ideal for small kitchens
customer_reviews.text: Here I am a couple of years later still LOVING my under the counter can opener!! Why are these so hard to find? It is one less thing cluttering the counter-top! It works perfectly and I have even opened large cans with it! This is one my best purchases!
customer_reviews.author: CLL

customer_reviews.title: Hand saver
customer_reviews.text: I got this for a gift for my mother in law. She loves it especially since she has arthritis in her hands. It was easy to install too..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working in less than a year
customer_reviews.text: Product cutting arm stopped working after 10 months. I had to remove it and adjust the cutting mechanism. Then 2 months later the drive mechanism ceased to work. I don't know if it is just this unit as I had an identical until that worked for over three years.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The perfect CanOpener!
customer_reviews.text: This is the third Black & Decker spacemaker can opener I've owned over the course of 17 years and I would buy it again if this one ever breaks. Great design and it works very well with all size cans.
customer_reviews.author: MrsLighting

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean!
customer_reviews.text: When it arrived,I first red the instructions @ it wouldn't replace my old black n decker . Because I had a 1& 1/2" board .I was a little disappointed that they didn't have spacers to mount it! They said to send it back!. I made spacers. And that's why I didn't give a better rating! I like it better than my 30 yr old one because it's easy to clean!
customer_reviews.author: Wayne M. Navarre

customer_reviews.title: Tricky to install
customer_reviews.text: Works well but very tricky to install. The template for drilling the mounting holes is very deceptive. You must mount the unit further toward the front of the cabinet so that the cutting blade lever clears the cabinet face when lifted. Took me 3 attempts to get it right and I'm pretty handy at such things.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Works under cabinet with lip if you make a bracket.
customer_reviews.text: Only works if the bottom of the cabinet is flat according to the instructions. My cabinet has a lower lip. I made a bracket, got longer screws, it mounted fine. It is working great, although my wife likes it better without the big front cover. Removed 2 pins, took off the cover, and my wife is happy with a new working can opener.
customer_reviews.author: Roary II VW

customer_reviews.title: For most part we like it
customer_reviews.text: Like and dislike door. Gets in way sometimes but at same time like how it hides blade.
customer_reviews.author: kidkjbiker

customer_reviews.title: It opens cans.
customer_reviews.text: It works. But not on big cans. Old type of opener makes sharp edge. It does fit under the cabinet which was my driving decision. Instructions for installation are good.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Good under counter operer
customer_reviews.text: This model works fine. Opened every can we have offered to it. Don't know what else to say. It's a can opener and that is what it does.
customer_reviews.author: square dog 2

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Comes with all parts to install. Has a diagram to make drill holes through so they line up perfectly. Easy to install. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Crissy S.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent machine
customer_reviews.text: We have bought so many manual can openers that just kept breaking. This automatic Black and Decker is so easy to use and works wonderfully! I also love that I have a little extra room in my utensil drawer since this stays above the countertop.
customer_reviews.author: Felicia McGraw

customer_reviews.title: This works well and was easy enough to mount under a cabinet
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one we've had. the first lasted quite a while. This works well and was easy enough to mount under a cabinet. Clean looking and has a knife sharpener, bottle opener and a plastic bag opener in addition to the opener which is great.
customer_reviews.author: Skip

customer_reviews.title: It works. I had to add extra "spacers" but ...
customer_reviews.text: It works. I had to add extra "spacers" but that may have well been my cabinets. As a matter of fact, I had to use a 2 x 4 cut to length for the spacer. It threw my "GFI" plug one time since I got it because it would not "grab" a can top to open it. After multiple attempts it threw the switch. It is OK, I just had to "learn" how to use it.
customer_reviews.author: tim03aw

customer_reviews.title: Different Style Opener
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't aware that the new Black & Decker Spacemaker can opener had a compartment that had to be opened and pulled down before you can open a can. I would prefer the old style where you just reach up with the can and open it. As far as performing the task that it's intended for, it works great but I wouldn't have purchased if I had known that I had to do the extra steps.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Smith

customer_reviews.title: watch out
customer_reviews.text: this product has not been made for years, therefore, there is no warranty on it. check and make sure there is product from the manufacturer before buying anything from this vendor. who knows how long it has been sitting around in a warehouse.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good unit
customer_reviews.text: Hard to find under counter one but this is a nice one but as other reviews started it needs spacers . We improvised some.. It does the job!!
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda

customer_reviews.title: Purchased this to replace an old spacemaker can opener. ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to replace an old spacemaker can opener. In the questions and answers section I verified it would fit the same as the old one. Not so. New holes would need to be drilled and the handle lift is totally different. Won't lift because of need for more clearance.
customer_reviews.author: grandmother of scooby-doo fans

customer_reviews.title: Spacesaver opener can be mounted on most cabinets with planning.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace another Black and Decker spacesaver can opener that was still working but was white. This can be mounted to cabinets without flat bottoms with the provided screws and spacers. Take care when planning where to drill so the opener lever has full range of motion. The top plastic washers can be trimmed to meet tight clearances. Works just as well as the one it replaced. Plus it has a cover and bottle opener and knife sharpener.
customer_reviews.author: John Darner

product_meta.title: BLACK+DECKER Spacemaker Multi-Purpose Can Opener, Black, CO100B
product_meta.description: Save time and space in the kitchen with the Black+Decker Spacemaker Multi-Purpose Can Opener. The unit mounts securely under cabinets for easy access and reliable performance, freeing up valuable counter space for all your kitchen tasks. The power pierce cutter easily removes can lids with hands-free operation. Other features include: bag cutter, bottle opener, knife sharpener. The power cord stores conveniently in the back of the unit, and an easy-open door conceals the tools when not in use.Two person installation recommended. Requires tape, ruler, electric drill with a 1/32” drill bit and a ¼” drill bit, screwdriver and protective glasses. Recommended for installation only on flat bottom cabinets (without bottom light rail molding). Several standard screw lengths are provided to fit a range of standard cabinets but may not fit all cabinet sizes Features 3-in-1 Included Components: Can Opener, Several standard screw lengths to fit a range of standard cabinets
feature_bullets: Power Pierce Cutter- Quickly remove can lids with the power pierce cutter that does all the work for you. Dimensions : 8.4 x 5.5 x 8.3 inches
Multi-Tool- More than just a can opener, this versatile tool includes a bag cutter, bottle opener, and knife sharpener
Space Saving-The multi-purpose tool saves space on your countertop by attaching to the underside of cabinets for convenient access

Swing-Open Door- All the great features are concealed behind a swing-open door that gives the unit a sleek look, plus, the power cord stores in the back of the unit so you can use the exact length you need without creating clutter
Auto Shutoff - The unit shuts off when not in use. No need to worry about power switches
Swing-open door for convenient accessibility; automatic shut-off.Measures approximately 6.5 by 7.5 by 5 inches
Multi-purpose can opener with power-pierce cutter
Swing-open door for convenient accessibility; automatic shut-off
Installs easily under a cabinet to save on space; cord storage
Includes built-in bag cutter, bottle opener, and knife sharpener

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars2,153 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
